20101227013621.000|20101227013622.000|CC1|CANCELING 850 OF ITS 5,000 DAILY
20101227013622.000|20101227013624.000|CC1|FLIGHTS.

20101227013631.000|20101227013632.000|CC1|FRANCISCO GOT CAUGHT UP IN THE

20101227014250.000|20101227014253.000|CC1|WHY THE U.S. GOVERNMENT IS      
20101227014253.000|20101227014254.000|CC1|HANDING OUT BONUSES TO COMBAT   
20101227014254.000|20101227014259.000|CC1|TROOPS WHO SERVED OVERTIME.     
20101227014259.000|20101227014259.000|XDS|%    TITLE: BMPX0078000H
20101227014259.000|20101227014554.000|SEG_01|Type=Commercial
20101227014259.000|20101227014303.000|CC1|   lurking, waiting to strike.e 
20101227014303.000|20101227014303.000|CC1|          A heart attack        
20101227014303.000|20101227014306.000|CC1|     that's caused by a clot,   
20101227014306.000|20101227014308.000|CC1|     one that could be fatal.   
20101227014308.000|20101227014309.000|CC1|   But PLAVIX helps save lives. 
20101227014309.000|20101227014309.000|CC1|        PLAVIX, taken with      
20101227014309.000|20101227014311.000|CC1|      other heart medicines,    
20101227014311.000|20101227014311.000|CC1|      goes beyond what other    
20101227014311.000|20101227014314.000|CC1|    heart medicines do alone,   
20101227014314.000|20101227014314.000|CC1|  to provide greater protection 
20101227014314.000|20101227014316.000|CC1|       against heart attack     
20101227014316.000|20101227014318.000|CC1|     or stroke and even death   
20101227014318.000|20101227014318.000|CC1|            by helping          
20101227014318.000|20101227014319.000|CC1|     to keep blood platelets    
20101227014319.000|20101227014319.000|CC1|      from sticking together    
20101227014319.000|20101227014322.000|CC1|   and forming dangerous clots. 
20101227014322.000|20101227014322.000|CC1|         Ask your doctor        
20101227014322.000|20101227014325.000|CC1|   if PLAVIX is right for you.  
20101227014325.000|20101227014325.000|CC1|      Protection that helps     
20101227014325.000|20101227014327.000|CC1|           save lives.          
20101227014327.000|20101227014327.000|CC1|       [ Female Announcer ]     
20101227014327.000|20101227014329.000|CC1|     Certain genetic factors    
20101227014329.000|20101227014329.000|CC1|       and some medicines,      
20101227014329.000|20101227014331.000|CC1|        such as Prilosec,       
20101227014331.000|20101227014332.000|CC1|   reduce the effect of PLAVIX  
20101227014332.000|20101227014332.000|CC1|   leaving you at greater risk  
20101227014332.000|20101227014335.000|CC1|   for heart attack and stroke. 
20101227014335.000|20101227014335.000|CC1|       Your doctor may use      
20101227014335.000|20101227014336.000|CC1|          genetic tests         
20101227014336.000|20101227014338.000|CC1|     to determine treatment.    
20101227014338.000|20101227014338.000|CC1|     Don't stop taking PLAVIX   
20101227014338.000|20101227014340.000|CC1|  without talking to your doctor
20101227014340.000|20101227014340.000|CC1|   as your risk of heart attack 
20101227014340.000|20101227014342.000|CC1|     or stroke may increase.    
20101227014342.000|20101227014342.000|CC1|  People with stomach ulcers or 
20101227014342.000|20101227014344.000|CC1|  conditions that cause bleeding
20101227014344.000|20101227014346.000|CC1|      should not use PLAVIX.    
20101227014346.000|20101227014346.000|CC1|       Taking PLAVIX alone      
20101227014346.000|20101227014348.000|CC1|  or with some other medicines, 
20101227014348.000|20101227014348.000|CC1|        including aspirin,      
20101227014348.000|20101227014350.000|CC1|   may increase bleeding risk,  
20101227014350.000|20101227014350.000|CC1|       so tell your doctor      
20101227014350.000|20101227014353.000|CC1|      when planning surgery.    
20101227014353.000|20101227014353.000|CC1|         Tell your doctor       
20101227014353.000|20101227014354.000|CC1|     all medicines you take,    
20101227014354.000|20101227014354.000|CC1|  including aspirin, especially 
20101227014354.000|20101227014357.000|CC1|     if you've had a stroke.    
20101227014357.000|20101227014357.000|CC1|  If fever, unexplained weakness
20101227014357.000|20101227014359.000|CC1|      or confusion develops,    
20101227014359.000|20101227014401.000|CC1|    tell your doctor promptly.  
20101227014401.000|20101227014403.000|CC1|    These may be signs of TTP,  
20101227014403.000|20101227014403.000|CC1|      a rare but potentially    
20101227014403.000|20101227014405.000|CC1|   life-threatening condition,  
20101227014405.000|20101227014405.000|CC1|   reported sometimes less than 
20101227014405.000|20101227014408.000|CC1|  2 weeks after starting PLAVIX.

20101227014955.000|20101227014958.000|CC1|  BLOOD DISORDERS HAVE OCCURRED.
20101227014958.000|20101227014959.000|CC1|     BEFORE STARTING Enbrel,    
20101227014959.000|20101227014959.000|CC1|   YOUR DOCTOR SHOULD TEST YOU  
20101227014959.000|20101227015001.000|CC1|        FOR TUBERCULOSIS.       
20101227015001.000|20101227015001.000|CC1|   ASK YOUR DOCTOR IF YOU LIVE  
20101227015001.000|20101227015004.000|CC1|     OR HAVE LIVED IN AN AREA   
20101227015004.000|20101227015004.000|CC1| WHERE CERTAIN FUNGAL INFECTIONS
20101227015004.000|20101227015006.000|CC1|           ARE COMMON.          
20101227015006.000|20101227015006.000|CC1|  DON'T START Enbrel IF YOU HAVE
20101227015006.000|20101227015009.000|CC1|    AN INFECTION LIKE THE FLU.  
20101227015009.000|20101227015009.000|CC1|         TELL YOUR DOCTOR       
20101227015009.000|20101227015011.000|CC1|  IF YOU'RE PRONE TO INFECTIONS,
20101227015011.000|20101227015011.000|CC1|       HAVE CUTS OR SORES,      
20101227015011.000|20101227015014.000|CC1|      HAVE HAD HEPATITIS B,     
20101227015014.000|20101227015014.000|CC1|        HAVE BEEN TREATED       
20101227015014.000|20101227015015.000|CC1|        FOR HEART FAILURE,
